headline: The Best Chicken Fried Steak
description: This chicken fried steak recipe is a Southern favorite! Featuring crispy, breaded cube steaks drenched in a creamy gravy, it will be a sure hit with everyone at your table.

video.name: How to Cook Chicken Fried Steak

name: The Best Chicken Fried Steak
recipeIngredient: kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place steaks between 2 layers of plastic and pound to a thickness of 1/4 inch.
Place 2 cups flour in a shallow bowl.
Stir together baking powder, baking soda 1 teaspoon pepper, and 3/4 teaspoon salt in second shallow bowl. Add buttermilk, Tabasco sauce, egg, and garlic; stir to combine.
Heat shortening in a deep cast-iron skillet to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Place a wire rack over a sheet of parchment paper.

While the shortening is heating, dredge a steak in flour to coat; shake off excess. Dip into buttermilk batter; lift up so excess batter drips back into the bowl. Press in flour again to coat both sides completely. Place breaded steak on the wire rack and repeat to bread remaining steaks.
Fry steaks, in batches if necessary, until evenly golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Remove steaks to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Cover with foil to keep warm while you make the gravy.
Drain fat from the skillet, reserving 1/4 cup of the liquid and as much of the solid remnants as possible.
Return the skillet to medium-low heat; add the reserved oil. Whisk the remaining 1/4 cup flour into the oil. Scrape the bottom of the pan with a spatula to release solids into the gravy.
Stir in milk, increase the heat to medium, and bring the gravy to a simmer. Cook, stirring often, until thick, 6 to 7 minutes. Season with kosher salt and pepper.
Transfer steaks to a platter and pour gravy over top.

review.reviewBody: Followed the recipe for the chicken fried steak was really tasty, thanks for sharing.
Very good!

I was so disappointed that the breading didn't stick to the cube steaks. I've made this several different ways and it has always stuck thought I would try this time but it didn't. I won't make this again.
Made according to recipe and it was a hit. Will be making again.
We loved it ‚ù§Ô∏è
Fantastic! The coating came out nice and crunchy.
Great
It was a bit of work to make, but oh my üò≤üò≤üò≤ it was delicious. I will be making this again in the future.

It's a killer; in the same category as my breakfast meal of pound of bacon, fried crisply, cooking 3 eggs in the bacon fat from the bacon, biscuits coated with bacon fat and real butter then gravy made from bacon fat and bacon residue, from frying, to top off all previously fried food as desired. Laripin good!!!!
ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT‚ù§ DELICIOUSüòã NO LEFTOVERS.
It looks so good I just have to try it for my Sunday Dinner Thank you I will sure let you know how it comes out and thank you again God bless you
My husband and I love this recipe especially the gravy! My grandma made this gravy and she never showed me how to make her gravy! Delicious as is! Didn't change a thing!
The steaks were delicious but didn't care much for the gravy

I made this recipe but with a few tweaks. First, I double dipped the steaks in the batter. Also, i don't recall if you mentioned it, but when you are placing the steaks in the flour mixture, you have to press hard so that the flour really sticks. After the steaks were breaded, I put them in the freezer for about 30 minutes. This helped the breading to really stick and they came out beautifully. When they were done frying, I transferred them to an air frier set on the lowest temp (180¬∞) and not only did they stay warm, the air frier added a crisp to the breading that was just marvelous. Loved the recipe.
My husbands favorite meal is Chicken Fried Steak. He LOVES it with brown gravy. I made it using this recipe and WOWZA!! It was fantastic!!!
Perfect CFS! Next time, I will season the meat with a little salt before the battering step but the recipe is very good as written. Thank you!
Awesome! Best crust ever! Everyone loved it. I used a few additional spices and more eggs. I spice my flour, milk mixture and meat. I did not have butter milk but it was still awesome.

I used this recipe as a jumping off point. My changes are: omit pepper, salt and garlic; replace with 1T cajun/creole seasoning. I also S&P(a bit of the cajun here doesnt hurt either) the meat before coating with flour/batter. Turned out wonderfully with a little extra 'kick.' Make sure you get ALL the scrapings out of the oil and add back into the simmering gravy!!
The gravy was very bland. The blandness of the gravy spoiled the nice flavor of the meat. An awful lot of ingredients for a so-so dish. Not worth the bother.
It was a good recipe. I enjoyed it and woukd make it again. No chamges needed.
Gonna gird my loins with this fried meat at the next insurrection. Freedom!

This wasn't bad. My son had been asking for a CFS dish. I found this and decided to try it. I had to use thin cut chicken breasts as I could find no cube steaks at the store. I used the flour/batter measurements (which were too much for 4-6 thin breasts) and fried in veg oil as it was what I had. I added a dash of taco sauce instead of tabasco. I re-seasoned the drippings and made a gravy.
The taste of the chicken was good. The batter did stay on and was crispy rather than the sort of sogginess you can get with breadcrumbs. The gravy was bland though. It needed something so after thinking a minute we added a dash of nutmeg to it and that worked well enough.
If I make it again, I will have to tweak it further, but it is not a bad starting point.
Was great, made it just as written. Will be making agin
Needs extra salt throughout; batter, flour, gravy

We loved this! My husband and mother-in-law are both so so picky. They both said it was great. My mother-in-law said ‚ÄúYou made this, you fried it.. fantastic!‚Äù Our 5 year old daughter said ‚ÄúTwo thumbs up!‚Äù
My husband said ‚ÄúThis is a keeper!‚Äù Thank you so much. ????????

I make this often. It's as good as any chicken fried steak I've ever had in a Texas restaurant or diner. Outstanding! For my stove and cast iron skillet, 2.5 minutes per side with only one flip works perfectly. (Hard to imagine 5 minutes per side without burning, but I guess everyone's stove is different.) My only criticism of the recipe is that when making the gravy, "remaining flour" is a little vague because it varies a bit. (Sometimes I make 4 steaks at a time, sometimes 6, sometimes they dredge easily, sometimes not, etc.) I've found that measuring 1/4 C of flour with the 1/4 C of remaining shortening works great. Great recipe. It has permanently replaced the three other chicken fried steak recipes I tried before discovering this one.

It‚Äôs a good recipe to get you started and to learn how to cook this dish, but it has no flavor at all. I had to add lots of salt the first time to get sun flavor. I made it a second time and added my own seasonings.. they just didn‚Äôt work with it though. It comes out a bit soggy too. Good starter, but needs adjustments.

Delicious! I made it as written by except to season the meat with salt & pepper and let it sit while preparing the batter. I feel like the meat wouldn‚Äôt have been as flavorful had I not done that. It also seemed like there was twice as much flour & batter as needed for four steaks, so next time I‚Äôll keep that in mind and get another few steaks. But the method of preparation and cooking time were dead on! I will definitely make again & again.
Great recipe! I made this with really thin sliced ribeyes and mushroom gravy. I used Paprika instead of the Tabasco.
Yummy!

Luckily my mashed potatoes saved the day. The batter creates a crust thicker than the actual meat itself. Very little flavor in the crust or, the gravy, I would have done better to simply saut√© it without all this prep and ensuing mess. I believe I followed the recipe exactly. But the whole did not come close to equaling the parts. Very disappointing.

My husband loves chicken fried steak. He pretty much doesn't eat meat, but he will eat this! We really enjoyed the steak part, but the gravy was missing something for us. Next time I will cut out some or all of the milk and add stock to it.

I loved this recipe... I didn't use the buttermilk but canned milk. However, it was delicious. 
My hubby loves chicken fried steak and the crust was perfect.

Great recipie. Mine turned out well done and crispy. Next time I will cook a little less and maybe add a seasoned salt or cajun seasoning in the flour mix for more flavor in the breading. I also added a cube of chicken bouillon to the gravy to add a little depth of flavor.

Very bland. I made the recipe as it stated and all I could taste was the Tabasco. It also needs quite a bit of salt. I suggest seasoning the flour instead of the dipping mixture with the seasoning and just using the egg and Buttermilk together. I would not make again.
I made this and my family loved it.. I used avacado oil for frying it up and for the gravy. Delicious

After at least 2 unsuccessful attempts at chicken fried steak, I decided to try one more time. SO happy that I did! The coating was crispy, the cube steak tender and the sauce was nice and thick. The hot sauce added just a hint of spicy kick that was not overwhelming in the least. In fact, next time I may use a little more. This recipe is definitely going into the "make again soon" file!

Excellent, flavorful recipe. I seasoned the steak with a little season salt, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper and paprika after flattening the steaks, but before coating them in flour - buttermilk - flour. My whole family enjoyed this recipe tremendously!

I have never eaten a chicken fried steak in Texas with such a thick heavy batter coating 
I had to add an additional cup of milk to make it useable and I really didn‚Äôt like the thickness of the coating 
Won‚Äôt be using again
Should of read instructions over a few times as I wasn't clear on some stuff, but overall very good.
Y'all... This was SO good. I hate when people say do this and not that. The ONLY altercation I made was using peanut oil because I didn't have any lard or Crisco... Perfection!
My family loved it. Best I ever made. Will certainly make it again.

Deee-licious I made it in the air fryer at 360¬∞ for 10 minutes, flipping them over halfway through. A little bit of the breading came off when I turned them over, but I just added some batter and flour to the bare spots and sprayed them with Pam, and they cooked up just fine.
too much garlic not enough flavor it lacks seasoings do not make this
Followed the recipe to a T and it didn‚Äôt have very much taste. The gravy wasn‚Äôt flavorful at all.
I halved the recipe and added two beef bullion cubes to the gravy, which gave it a rich flavor. Also seasoning the meat before hand as suggested below. Really tender and delicious!

In step 3 when you make the gravy, you should to brown the flour before you add the milk. Uncooked flour tastes terrible. That's probably why some have said the flour taste is too strong. Also add the milk slowly to avoid lumps.
Great recipe! All I had to fry them in was lard so they were exceptionally good.

Steak and breading were good enough but the gravy was, well, meh. 

We put the gravy over hash browns. The flavor of the hash browns carried the gravy. 
For that many carbs in a sitting, I need a lot more flavor going on.
Very good and easy to make
Daaaaaaaaaaaaaaaayum!!!!! Soooooooo good!
Yum! Fried for 3 minutes per side in a half cup of Cisco which left the perfect amount for the gravy. Added some garlic powder to the flour mixture. All enjoyed.

I was really scared to make this because I‚Äôm not very experienced at frying and it is just an intimidating dish for me. My husband always wants it and I have been psyching myself up to make this for a week, got the ingredients and everything. I had to kiss up a little today (haha) so I went ahead and tried it. I followed it exactly and I‚Äôm grateful that the results turned out! I did have to let them ‚Äúrest‚Äù before frying because of time and it was actually helpful (maybe?) I haven‚Äôt done it otherwise. I‚Äôm gonna try this gravy too. Another scary thing for me. Wish me luck!

There‚Äôs good and bad here. The batter is excellent but the gravy is horrible and needs several adjustments. I made exactly as written and it went very well until I tasted the gravy, just before serving. It just tasted like flour. I added about 10 cranks of salt and 20 cranks of black pepper, a dash of cayenne, a teaspoon of paprika and a teaspoon of parsley. These minor additions made all the difference. I didn‚Äôt have any shortening so fried in canola oil and it came out nice and crispy.

came out terrible. all the coating came off the steak as soon as it hit the oil. I ended up with plain fried steak. I followed the instructions to the letter. I even tried to re-flour the steak after the first one lost all its coating.
Great Recipe, I had a problem getting breading to stay on after frying.

I had never known how to batter/bread a chicken fried steak until now! This recipe came out great, next time I'll let the flour cook a little longer with the shortening before adding the milk to cook away more of the flour taste, otherwise easy and delicious! It was crispy and tasted very authentic.

Overall it was fine but could have used a lot more seasoning in my opinion. The meat was a little hard and the gravy bland, it took more than twice as long as it stated to cook which I typically figure it will take me longer but not that much longer

Anemic, bland, boring. Spices need to be bumped up a lot and not just hot sauce heat. Dredge flour needs more flavor as well. This was only the "Best" because it's named that and not because it really is.

This is the #1 meal in our house. Only change I make is adding a splash of hot sauce to the gravy. We also use pork instead of beef cube steaks but that's personal preference. Other than that...this is perfect. I've even tried it with chicken (chicken fried chicken) and it also turned out amazing.
Loved it, easy to make. I paired it with asparagus and saut√©ed mushrooms.

My husband missed his mom's chicken fried steak she would make when he was a kid. even now she can't remember how she made it. I was encouraged by all the good reviews of this one. Now his favorite all time chicken fried steak and gravy!!
It was just as stated, "The Best." Thanks for a great recipe!

I have never had issues with recipes on this site until now. I will never make this again. First off, the covering on the meat was so thick that the meat did not cook within 5 minutes and some of the batter was still wet. The next thing I noticed was that I need to use 3 cups of oil for my gravy!! Yeah, not gonna happen. I am not going to ingest 3 cups of oil, or even 3/4 cup of oil into my body. That is extremely unhealthy and I don't intend to die young thank you! My gravy made for 4 persons has less than 1/2 cup of oil and includes more actual drippings that just straight up lard.

I just knew it would be good
And it was. My family loved it, and said it was the best I ever cooked and to do it this way from now on.

This was delicious. I didn't make any changes..and it was great.
 I did have to cook the steaks much longer than 2-3 minutes on each side though. More like 10 minutes

Well...since this already isn't exactly heart-healthy, I opted to use some collected bacon grease instead of the suggested vegetable shortening. It made for a very tasty meal...but I think I'll try having the vegetable shortening on hand next time. I also like the idea of salting and peppering the round steak prior to dipping as another reviewer suggested.

I have tried so many CFS recipes and they all turned-out just OK. I followed this one to the letter, with the exception of using a packaged gravy. My husband was so happy and he thought it was my best effort to date for CFS. I even used shortening! This one is a keeper and I will be making it again, soon.

I will state categorically, as a Texan, that this is THE MOST DELICIOUS chicken fried steak recipe versus anything out there! It used the exact and simple ingredients my grandmother used....most impressive and valuable are the ratios for the gravy---SPOT ON! Wonderful! RJ *****
Lacked flavor and was disappointing. I followed the recipe as is.
I forgot to get a picture but, it turned out wonderful. My family loved the gravy and the steak batter actually stuck! Thank you so much for the wonderful recipe.

Was a hit!! I followed the recipe this time, may add some extra spices to the mix next time, (our preference).

I do believe, that this meal will be making somewhat of a regular appearance's on our dinner table in the future.
We never had Chicken Fried Steak before but heard a lot about it, so i decided to try and make it. It was delicious! The recipe wasn't complicated and the ingredients were simple.

I agree with the tips of other reviewers! Season the meat before breading. Add seasoning to the flour. We also like sausage gravy (country gravy) with ours versus the plain gravy that is included in the receipe.
My family didn‚Äôt like this,so I will not be making it again.
absolutely delicious, I have made chicken fried chicken and steak many times, this is the best version.
Truly is THE BEST!! Thank you for sharing!
This recipe is fantastic. I made it exactly as written and it was totally devoured. It‚Äôs going to be made again and again.
Easy to make and tastes great!
Easy recipe to follow, turned out great!!
This is indeed the best Country Fried Steak I‚Äôve ever had. Used 1/2 & 1/2 creamer in place of Buttermilk.

This recipe was a big waste of time. The steak itself turned out very bland, which surprised me. The gravy was the worst part though. For the gravy, the roux to liquid ratio looked off to me when I read the recipe, but against my instincts, I made it as written. It just would not thicken to be a truly creamy gravy. I had to add a slurry of flour and milk to get it to thicken, which of course diluted the taste. Although a relatively inexpensive meal to make, it requires a lot of dishes, time and cleanup. That‚Äôs a real bummer when the food doesn‚Äôt even taste great. I mean we ate it and won‚Äôt go to bed hungry tonight. That‚Äôs the best thing I can say about this recipe.
it came out great! It was also easy to make. The only thing i can think of is that the gravy needed more salt.
I followed the recipe without modification - good directions. This turned out really tasty, but it is a fair amount of work, and mess. Good recipe, but easier to get it at a restaurant .

Great recipe! I was able to use 8 steaks for the entire dredging. I‚Äôd use more fresh black pepper, though. Testing it, my first 2 were darker and crispier due to heat. Make sure to monitor and use no more than 325.

I made this with both beef and chicken breast. I didn't change the recipe in anyway the first time, but cut it in half for the chicken...there are only two of us. The second time I doubled the amount of hot sauce and still couldn't taste it, but we are used to spicy foods. The part that I found unique was the addition of baking powder and soda. The coating was fantastic, and I will be using this same recipe with fish, pork...anything. It was really the best I have found, and I am nearly 60 years old.
Delicious recipe
Amazing

I think this was pretty good but my preference is more flavor. Next time, I will add more Tabasco, Lots more pepper maybe onion Powder. It was a little
Confusing (maybe just for me) when it said add the rest of the flour. I assume it meant the 1/4 C reserved and not the left over dry breading mix. Otherwise, really easy and good. I just like a lot of seasoning
Very good! My family loved it!
This was amazing! The proudest I have ever been cooking and have never made Chicken Fried Steak before. Will be making this a lot if I have anything to say about it. Thank you!

I‚Äôve made this several times each time following the directions other then I don‚Äôt add salt (just me). I‚Äôve found it makes a lot so I‚Äôm able to double coat the meat for extra crispness. Some things I‚Äôve done to help the process is dry the meat completely and season with pepper (and salt if you want) after coating it I put in the fridge for a few minutes 20 minutes or so if you have enough time. After frying I keep them warm in the oven (about 350) until serving. Can‚Äôt say enough about this dish!!!
This is by far the best chicken fried steak recipe that I have ever cooked!! It renders me useless after eating it! I will only make this once a month!!

First time making a meal with new ingredients and not something I‚Äôm already use to making and I have to say my hubby and kids enjoyed it very much, to where they said I gotta make more recipes from here. My hubby loved it so much he said, ‚Äúwho needs cotton patch (lol)‚Äù
Amazing and pretty easy to make! I opted to fry it in vegetable oil until the crust was golden and then throw it in the oven for a bit until it was cooked all the way through.
This was the tastiest thing I‚Äôve had in a very long time! Thank you!

My mother and I cooked this today. We followed the recipe EXACTLY. It was BAD! Both the actual steak AND the "gravy" were SUPER BLAND. There are BARELY any herbs or spices to it. My brother compared it to cooked cardboard. Would NOT make it again.

I ruined it! I've used this amazing recipe before, and it is delicious! This time, I was in way too much of a rush. I didn't stir the batter enough and the dish I chose for the batter was too deep. All my seasonings settled on the bottom and none got onto my steak! Learn from my mistakes my friends. This recipe is perfect but my chef (me) is not.

Truly, THE BEST. Soak meat in buttermilk the night prior to ensure your meat is tender. Dry between paper towels before dredging. Deep fat fryer at 340 deg F for 3 minutes. Place on rack in warm oven (220 deg F) as you fry the rest and to keep warm and crispy. Add cajun seasoning to flour dredge. 
I didn't use this recipe for the gravy, so comment is on steak only.
